key_facts: Countries are meeting in South Korea to finalize a global plastic treaty.
The treaty is considered one of the most significant since the Paris climate accord.
Oil-producing nations and fossil fuel industries oppose plastic production limits.
Environmental advocates say reducing plastic production is essential.
A 40% plastic production cut by 2040 is being proposed.
Some experts argue a 75% cut is needed to meet the 1.5Â°C target.
The treaty's final agreement remains uncertain.
A potential Trump presidency could influence the treaty's outcome.
Global South nations are pushing for ambitious action.
The treaty may shape future fossil fuel reliance and pollution policy.
